newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SOCCER-CAF CANCEL CLASH WITH ASIAN CHAMPIONS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CAF CANCEL CLASH WITH ASIAN CHAMPIONS.

text.p: This year's Afro-Asian Nations Cup competition between Saudi Arabia and South Africa has been cancelled, the Confederation of African Football (CAF) said on Tuesday.

CAF cited a heavy schedule of qualifying matches for the World Cup and African Nations Cup finals next year, plus the fact that both countries will be playing in the Confederations Cup in Riyadh in December, for the cancellation.
The Afro-Asian Nations Cup is traditionally played every two years between the African champions and the winners of the Asian Cup.
Saudi Arabia won the Asian Cup competition in December, 10 months after South Africa's success in the African Nations Cup finals.
The Afro-Asian Nations Cup has run since 1985, with Cameroon, Algeria, Japan, Nigeria and South Korea winning previous editions. The contest is traditionally decided over two legs.
South African Football Association officials said they were considering a Saudi offer to play a friendly international this year.
